atom.description: Product search returns results within 200 milliseconds at the 95th percentile when the product catalog contains 100,000 items and the query matches at least 50 results
observableOutcomes: p95 response time across 1,000 sequential search queries is below 200ms with a 100,000-product dataset
p95 response time remains below 200ms when query result sets range from 1 to 500 products
Median (p50) response time is below 100ms across all query patterns
Response times do not regress by more than 20% when the dataset grows from 50,000 to 100,000 products
atom.reasoning: Derived from search-performance.e2e-spec.ts: the test seeds the database with 100,000 product records and measures query response times across 1,000 search requests with varying result-set sizes. The p95 latency is asserted to be below 200ms. A dataset-scaling test verifies sub-linear regression as catalog size doubles. This atom captures a single quantifiable performance contract — search latency — with four independent measurement dimensions that together prove the system meets its latency SLA under realistic conditions.
atom.sourceTestName: should return search results within 200ms at p95 for 100k products
